title: The Mapmaker, a poem by Eli Steier
author: Eli Steier

coauthors.name: Eli Steier
coauthors.bio: Eli Steier is an avid fan of the often-libeled bird, the pigeon. This may have been the natural result of being born and raised in Queens. A graduate of SUNY Stony Brook, he has studied at Pardes in Israel, and is a former board member of the Wandering Jews of Astoria.

excerpt: A poem with perspective by Eli Steier. . . .
content:
Contribute a translation Source (English)

Cold facts.
Colder realities.
The preacher who lost his way
The librarian who empties the shelves
The cook without a spoon
The child masking as a king
The king masking as a child.
The mapmaker studies them all
Furrowing his brow tightly
Crafting lines delicately.
Charges
Nothing
And
Changes
Everything
